definitions.definition: a figure of a person or an animal in stone, metal, etc., usually the same size as in real life or larger
definitions.labels: (US English)(US English)(US English)(especially British English)(North American English usually)(British English)(North American English)

examples.text: The protesters toppled a statue of King George III.
The statue stands in one of the main squares.
the dedicatory inscription on the statue base
the unveiling of a statue to Lord Brown

wordOrigin: Middle English: from Old French, from Latin statua, from stare ‘to stand’.
